page.title: 02 HIGHAM STATION
page.content: Higham Station was built in about 1876. the station is used particularly by commuters who work in London and shoppers who travel to Gravesend and the Medway Towns. As well as passenger trains many goods trains pass the station with coal from the Kent coalfields and oil going ti Kingsnorth power station on the Isle of Grain. The station is run by only one man who is responsible for everything. In the morning and evening rush hours 300 to 400 people use the station. The station has recently become a lot busier. Next to the station is the beginning of a 4 mile long tunnel which is thought to be one of the oldest in the country. The tunnel was once a canal carrying barges to the Isle of Grain.
